title: A1502 Macbook Pro EFI general question regarding serial number
message:
What happens if I flash an EFI chip with a serial number that's not the original? My issue is, I needed to replace the EFI chip, but the serial number on the chip didn't match whats on the bottom cover. The customer said he had the bottom cover replaced, hence the difference in serial number.

Well, when i flash the chip with the serial number from the original chip, the comp. never boots, (i do have all voltages present and cpu warm). When i flashed the chip with the serial number on the bottom cover, i'm able to boot the laptop successfully and log into it.

title: A1502 Macbook Pro EFI general question regarding serial number
message: You cannot just flash another BIOS it will mess up the ME region. Upload the BIOS here and specify the serial number you want and I can make a known good BIOS for you.

title: A1502 Macbook Pro EFI general question regarding serial number
message:
I did use ghostlyhaks steps to set a clean ME region. But for some reason when i do it with the original serial number (which was pulled from the computers EFI chip) the computer never boots. Only when i use the serial number on the bottom cover, which isn't the original bottom cover (bottom cover was replaced recently), this is when i'm able to get it to boot.

Anyway, i've added a link to the file as i wasn't able to upload the .bin file. Thank you so much for your help.

[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1LD0HKiIGDaDTnX5vp-kb2uc1lTYMrSs9[/url]

Serial number is: C02PVZ3GFVH3 
This is the same serial number in the attached bios dump.

Again thanks a lot.

title: A1502 Macbook Pro EFI general question regarding serial number
A1502 Macbook Pro EFI general question regarding serial number
A1502 Macbook Pro EFI general question regarding serial number
message:
Yep this worked. Just curious what I was doing wrong. Does the bios I’m modifying have to be unlocked to modify and if so, how does one find an unlocked bios?
Or do I copy the bios data (except the ME region) from my locked bios and paste into the clean unlocked ME file?

title: A1502 Macbook Pro EFI general question regarding serial number
message:
I cleaned the ME region and took a known good BIOS and pasted your serial number into that. Then the checksum of the Fsys block that contains the serial number was corrected.

I can write a book about this or you can just buy the Medusa2 at cmizapper.com and that will do this for you.

title: A1502 Macbook Pro EFI general question regarding serial number
message: thanks. I think i will just go ahead and get the Medusa2. Thanks again for your assist.

title: A1502 Macbook Pro EFI general question regarding serial number
message: Got the Medusa2 and works great. Thanks. You can close this post.

A1502 Macbook Pro EFI general question regarding serial number
message:
Big thanks to you MacRepairAmb.

As I've tryed them all in the mean time,  then I can complete the list:
26: Show Medusa internal ROM 2 and 3
27: Load Medusa Internal ROM
28: Show Medusa ROM 3 ME Version
29: Verify ROM 3 in Medusa
30: TEST POWER
above it's just ?????????

Question when it's reading the Mac serial number of 2 differents 00165 board it's written BAD next to it  WHY?

title: A1502 Macbook Pro EFI general question regarding serial number
message: Checksum is bad. That’s why you will get a “bad” messiahs by the serial number. First read and store your current efi bios. The perform mode 12. But make sure you backup the efi data before you proceed.
